2. "The Conjuring" (2013) - This movie is based on the true story of paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren and their investigation into a haunted farmhouse. It's a well-crafted, suspenseful horror film that features some truly terrifying moments.
3. "Get Out" (2017) - This critically acclaimed horror movie follows a young black man who visits his white girlfriend's family and discovers that they have a sinister secret. It's a thought-provoking, socially conscious horror film that uses satire to comment on race and identity.
4. "A Quiet Place" (2018) - This movie takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where monsters that hunt by sound have wiped out most of humanity. It follows a family who must navigate their new reality in silence to avoid being killed. It's a tense, suspenseful film that relies on sound effects and visual storytelling to create a truly unsettling atmosphere.
5. "Hereditary" (2018) - This movie follows a family who are haunted by their own dark past after the death of their matriarch. It's a slow-burning, psychological horror film that features some truly disturbing moments and performances.

I hope these recommendations help you find a horror movie that you'll enjoy! Let me know if you have any other questions or preferences.
